channel.title: [help] People Cant Connect to Server[PI]
channel.description:
ok so to start off let me say that i am portforwarded and it is definitively the client because my old source worked yesterday.
ok so it works for me on my computer but it wont work on my laptop or my friends comp. The Client Base is [PI] i have changed all of the ip's to connect to mine and all of the 127.0.0.1 and i searched for 0.0.0.0. heres the source and client DL [url=http://www.google.org/runescape-development/google/downloads/303953-pi-cruelalityx-source-release-ll-stable-ll-good-features-ll-lot-more.html]http://www.google.org/runescape-development/google/downloads/303953-pi-cruelalityx-source-release-ll-stable-ll-good-features-ll-lot-more.html[/url]
sorry its from another site but i still need it fixed...
when i run it on my othercomp i get this.. (a bunch on errors and then...)
[code]caused by: java.io.fileNotFoundException: http://cruelalityx.com/webclient/cruelalityx.zip[/code]
heres everything that has to do with that code... In Client.java [code] drawLoadingText(0, "Connecting to File Server..."); new Update("http://cruelalityx.com/webclient/CruelalityX.zip", "CruelalityX.zip", signlink.findcachedir()); abyte0 = decompressors[0].decompress(i); }[/code]
and then in CacheDownload.java
[code] private final int VERSION = 1; // Version of cache //private String cacheLink = "http://uppit.com/28ue3guj7atk/CPS.zip"; // Link to cache private String cacheLink = "http://cruelalityx.com/webclient/CruelalityX.zip"; // Link to cache[/code]
if i change that client dosnt run (on my computer).
Do i take the cache and upload it somewhere and then put the link in there? or what..

item.title: [help] People Cant Connect to Server[PI]
item.dc:creator: @weed4u weed4u
item.description:
@weed4u wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:391844”][quote author=weed4u link=topic=489010.msg3575070#msg3575070 date=1303350397]

Probably because It’s trying to find a local file using the HTTP protocol.

Also, that’s not the way you handle “cache downloading”.

1st i dont know what HTTP protocol is.
2nd i didnt maje the cache downloading thing.
3rd do you think you could help me fix it?
msn: friend0623@live.com
(please respond if your going to add me)
[/quote]

If you don’t know what the HTTP Protocol is… You should probably stop now.[/quote]

why? cant you just help me its 1 error that this kid fixed but wont help me and i cant figure it out… i dont want to quit becuase i dont know what HTTP protocal is

Read full topic

item.title: [help] People Cant Connect to Server[PI]
item.dc:creator: @weed4u weed4u
item.description:
@weed4u wrote:

ok so to start off let me say that i am portforwarded and it is definitively the client because my old source worked yesterday.

ok so it works for me on my computer but it wont work on my laptop or my friends comp. The Client Base is [PI]
i have changed all of the ip’s to connect to mine and all of the 127.0.0.1 and i searched for 0.0.0.0.
heres the source and client DL
http://www.google.org/runescape-development/google/downloads/303953-pi-cruelalityx-source-release-ll-stable-ll-good-features-ll-lot-more.html

sorry its from another site but i still need it fixed…

when i run it on my othercomp i get this…
(a bunch on errors and then…)

heres everything that has to do with that code…
In Client.java

drawLoadingText(0, "Connecting to File Server..."); new Update("http://cruelalityx.com/webclient/CruelalityX.zip", "CruelalityX.zip", signlink.findcachedir()); abyte0 = decompressors[0].decompress(i); }

and then in CacheDownload.java

private final int VERSION = 1; // Version of cache //private String cacheLink = "http://uppit.com/28ue3guj7atk/CPS.zip"; // Link to cache private String cacheLink = "http://cruelalityx.com/webclient/CruelalityX.zip"; // Link to cache

if i change that client dosnt run (on my computer).

Do i take the cache and upload it somewhere and then put the link in there? or what…
